subject: Any Given Sunday
event:
Another week in the NFL.  The Giants won an ugly one over the Niners, and the Jets lost an uglier one to the Raiders.  I have to admit, both games frustrated the hell out of me.

The Giants defense showed up again, after having taken off the Cleveland game.  Six sacks, lots of pressure on the quarterback, three turnovers, even a safety.  That was the good news.  The offense left much to be desired, however.  The G-Men are now 5-1, but the creampuff portion of their schedule is over.  Next week they face another 5-1 team in the Pittsburgh Steelers, and we'll get the first true indication of how good they are.  

As for the Jets... sigh... 

The whole team played like crap in Oakland, but I have to blame the coaching for this loss.  After Brett Favre passes them down the field with a minute left to set up the field goal that sent the game into overtime, the Jets win the coin toss... and Mangini and Little Schott turn more conservative than Rush Limbaugh.  Run on first down, run on second down, throw on third and long.  Not once, but on all of our overtime possessions.  The Raider defense was gassed and demoralized by the end of regulation; if the Jets had come out in overtime and continued with the same wide-open passing attack that had tied the game, I'm convinced they would have claimed the victory.

Sad to say, the Jets are not playing like a playoff contender at this point.

comments.article:
I am still on the fence as to what the Jets can or can't do.
Consistence seems to be a problem with both the offense and the defense.

The Giants are only hurting themselves. They have no margin for error now.

How do you think the Titans are going to do next week?

The Dolphins lost. Oh well. Good, strong start to the season, but things seem to be coming apart.

Good luck to the Giants against the Steelers. I don't expect it'll be an easy game for either side.

Please use your influence as a famous author (well, more famous than I am, anyway) to get Favre to throw to Cotchery more often.

This will solve the Jets offensive woes, and will help my fantasy football team, thus solving two problems at once.

It wasn't going so well for the Jets even before overtime. They were going to lose anyway except they got lucky with the Oakland coach calling a timeout right as they kicked the first field goal, which they missed.
comments.subject: Jets :(

comments.article: At least your teams are playing and have potential.  The KC Chiefs are painful to watch.  And our quarterback is out for the season.  It's tough for a team to keep adjusting to a new quarterback.
Tell me about it...

"and Mangini and Little Schott turn more conservative than Rush Limbaugh."

Hahhahah funniest thing I heard all day.

I was waiting for you to talk about the jets game because I always liked the raiders and this one was hard for me. I agree the coaches were to blame for either team, if they were to lose. That icing the kicker thing, it didnt work in Arizona against Dallas and in that Washington game. And the plays both teams were calling at the times they did were just god awful. I thought Mangini was a good coach when he first came to NY but this year hes made some awful decisions. This team is great but there playing averege. I think if they dont make the playoffs its time for a coaching change,.... don't you agree?
comments.subject: On Jets

comments.article: Gotta love the Trogdor Avatar!  Strongbad Rules! :)
comments.subject: Trogdor!!!

comments.article: ...is pissin' me off.  Plax is about as unstable as TO or ocho psycho.
comments.subject: Plax...

comments.article: That's why the Steelers dumped him.
comments.subject: Re: Plax...

comments.article: I'm just happy that my Raiders finally got a win!  It wasn't pretty, but it's still a win! =)

I cannot even tell you how long the people of Pittsburgh have been plotting waiting for Plaxico to come home to Heinz Field!

On the bright side, the world's largest Zombie Walk taked place at the Monroeville Mall [where they filmed Dawn of the Dead ] and you figure Eli and Edwards and the other Giants can join right in--as they are dead men walking this Sunday...

It could be worse - you could be from Minnesota and have the Vikings (seriously - could they learn how to pass the ball without having it intercepted 15 times) AND Michele Bachman!

I look forward to your comments after the Vikings play the Giants in December. :)

Sad to say, the Jets are not playing like a playoff contender at this point.

No, but the Bucs are! W00t!!

Go Steelers!

Should be a good game.

What do you think about the whole Brett giving out packers info curfuffle?
Curfuffle? Whats a curfuffle?

no matter how hard they would have played i would not accept a win over the raiders. this was a "you win, no YOU win" kind of game. please lets throw up now.
and the giants, did manning loose his confidence again?
comments.subject: the wost game of the year

comments.article: The Giants didn't get a lot of respect at the start of the season, and I think we are starting to see why. In any case Eli is showing his true colors as a QB. The last part of the season last year was a fluke. Eli is right in the middle of the pack as far as QBs go. Sadly, the Jets were not a QB away from contention. The NFC East is the toughest division in football again, and Buffalo will win the AFC East. However, you should be grateful. I am a SEAHAWKS fan. Woe is me.

Good luck next week. With your leading passrushers out, I can see the Giants D having difficulties against the Steelers run game. The big matchup I see is the Giants WRs vs the Steelers secondary. Whoever wins that battle wins the game, IMO.

Definitely the must-watch game of the week, regardless of the outcome.
And we don't have McFadden, who has played surprisingly well of late, and we might not have Polamalu... This could be bad...
Man...the Seahawks are just pathetic right now. The defense played reasonably well, but the offense just stunk. They should put Hasselbeck on IR and play for the #1 pick next season.
comments.subject: This week

comments.article: I didn't get to see any of the games this weekend, but I did find it somewhat interesting that one NY area team hosted one of the Bay area teams, while the other Bay area team hosted the other NY area team.
Be thankful you do not live in the Detroit Lions catchment area, I refuse to call myself a fan after they hired Matt Millen.
Giants have to come to Pittsburgh next week. BWAHAHAHAHA! Two of the best teams in the league. It's gonna be good.
And whoda thunk it?  The Rams have won 2 in a row!  *Shock

Win one, lose one, win one, lose one. Aaaarrrgghh, this has turned into a brutal season for my Chargers, and I'm pretty ticked off right now.  We were playing Buffalo well enough to win, down by 6 points with 6 minutes left, driving down the field, poised to score when Rivers throws a bonehead pick at the 10 yard line that did us in.  Just brutal I tell yuh!!!
comments.subject: Where's the consistency?

comments.article:
You simply cannot default to the run when you have Brett Favre as QB. Basic, basic, basic.

At least the Texans won two in a row, and I can take my head out of the bag.
comments.subject: Favre?

comments.article: Bah. My team WAS the "creampuff" part of your schedule.  At least you have football to look forward to; the Niners are just painful to watch.  And firing Nolan isn't going to change a thing.

Amen Honey. It was a bad weekend, what with the Niners losing AND the Raiders Winning. Good lord, what a mess. At least the Cowboys lost--if they had one, I think I would have had to have drown myself in pudding.

But, buck up, we're playing the Seahawks this weekend--if we can't beat them, I tell ya what: I'll get enough pudding for both of us, and we can turn it into a party.

A creampuff team Mr Martin?

It is sad when the great franchise I remember from when I watched late night NFL once a week on a Tuesday night becomes a creampuff schedule date. I shed tears for the 49ers management/front office team of the 80's-90's, the wheels feel off somewhere.

Well the Giants win cost us a coach and I don't think Singletary inherits a football nirvana. I live in Australia so rarely get to watch the games I'd like so can't comment on the game but I will say the Giants Monday night game last week showed fragile shell flaws in the current champs. It is true that the Steelers will really test them but what has happened to the powerhouse era. I mean I know the league of parity but this year its ridiculous no team seems to be standing out in either league, there is no game which its safe to call. Tennessee vs Indy will really establish if they are a legit steamroller this year.

It is sad the Jets and there coaching staff don't seem to be able to let go Farve, he is a unique player who plays with the free ease of a phenom who truly loves the game. His gift is to play loose mostly it works sometimes it burns but it is always amazing to watch. The Jets coaches don't seem to embrace this they are playing not to loose and that is the antithesis of the Farve style and it shows.

Well the 49ers are dead this year I wonder when it will change. The Giants will win the East (the Cowboys are about to combust) but I think the path to the Superbowl goes through Carolina. The Jets will I think have a year where everyone wonders what it might have been if they had unleasehed Farve and ridden the tempest but instead tried not to lose and ultimately failed to win.
comments.subject: Creampuff??
